alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Hale; Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 5:17AM CDT until June 03 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Crosby, southern Floyd, southern Hale and Lubbock Counties. * WHEN...Until 600 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 511 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated rain due to thunderstorms. The heaviest rainfall rates up to 1.5 inches per hour were occurring in western Crosby County, including near the city of Ralls. Rainfall was diminishing across western Lubbock and southern Hale Counties. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected in Crosby County, with lesser amounts elsewhere. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lubbock, Slaton, Floydada, Abernathy, Crosbyton, Wolfforth, Idalou, Ralls, Petersburg, Lorenzo, Ransom Canyon, Cone, Lubbock International Airport, Downtown Lubbock, Texas Tech University, Woodrow, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Slide, Reese Center and Dougherty. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
